content:
This former Backdrop user is spamming the issues. Examples:

  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3174
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2432

I think we should be deleting their posts and sending them a message that they are free to comment in the Forum if they want to complain. The issue, in my mind, isn't that they're complaining about Backdrop but that they're posting the same message multiple times on totally unrelated issues.

Base/sub install profiles · Issue #3174 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Update (5th Mar): Need someone (or a few people) to do a code review please. I'd like to propose adding the ability for install profiles to define a 'base profile'. Here's the equiv...
Remove the unused "core": key from views .json config files. · Issue #2432 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Now that I am creating PRs that involve creating default views configs, I noticed that there are these lines added in the config files. What are they used for? Should we remove them if not used? Sh...

He's not been useful in the past either :disappointed: ...I've replied in one of the issues, to say that he's provided some interesting feedback in the issue queue over the years ...I intentionally said "interesting" instead of "useful", because there's a reason.
I'm not sure I see any harm in one message, but how many are we talking here?
I only spotted 2 ...I've replied to one, and then @kreynen responded on the other.
ok, well if we see a lot more maybe a PMC intervention would be helpful. but if there are only a few I'm happy to leave it be.
Yup ...I also say leave ti be for now :+1:
I took a look the other day and it was about 6 messages. In one case, someone had already deleted his message. BUT, I agree that we should just ignore it for now.
I deleted one of his messages which was completely irrelevant to the issue. Then I noticed more and posted here
It was 7 posts in 7 separate issues, each copied and pasted (exactly the same wording). To me, if its exactly the same wording, and if its unrelated to the issue in question, its spam.

Interesting; in my Android app (Octodroid) I can view the user's profile and there's a 'Public activity' tab that shows their comments across various issues (so I can scroll down and count the comments they've made that have the same wording). But I can't see anything like this on GitHub itself...

I noticed that, too, and so I searched & found some ways of locating that information, but the results are not the best.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39568301/how-can-i-find-all-public-comments-for-a-github-user
https://webapps.stackexchange.com/questions/103374/where-can-i-see-all-my-comments-on-issues-on-github

How can I find all public comments for a Github user?
Until recently I was able to find all my public comments using a link on my profile page. I was using this functionality to keep track of all issues where I have commented, but not contributed anyt...
Where can I see all my comments on issues on GitHub?
Where can I see all the comments I wrote on issues on the GitHub website? https://github.com/issues only list the issues I have opened, and not the issues I have commented on.
I had reported the user to github. They said they're investigating. Plus they sent me this link: https://help.github.com/articles/managing-disruptive-comments/
Hiding such comments (instead of deleting them) seems less brute. Might do that next time.
